posts.text_html: I got access to RStudio's AI enhanced beta, and oh my is it nice... Much number crunching to be had here, and way easier then copy/pasting between Claude Code/Codex and RStudio.
posts.text: I got access to RStudio's AI enhanced beta, and oh my is it nice... Much number crunching to be had here, and way easier then copy/pasting between Claude Code/Codex and RStudio.

posts.text_html:
I took the excellent work by @josephjefe.bsky.social and did some customizations to come up with some additional data points (PFF Snaps and rating data) to evaluate salary cap info, and hosted my first Shiny app which allows anyone to run this for all 32 teams.

hunsanger.shinyapps.io/shiny/
posts.text:
I took the excellent work by @josephjefe.bsky.social  and did some customizations to come up with some additional data points (PFF Snaps and rating data) to evaluate salary cap info, and hosted my first Shiny app which allows anyone to run this for all 32 teams. 

hunsanger.shinyapps.io/shiny/

posts.text_html:
Got bored, built a macOS swift BlueSky app.

Working:
- Posting to BlueSky
- Replying to posts
- Timeline
- Bookmarks
- Profile view

Not Working (yet):
- Notifications
- Quality search

I‚Äôm not sure how far I‚Äôll take this at this point, but a fun exercise in creating a macOS app.

posts.text_html: Gut feel is that üçäiPhone 17 Pro Max is calling my name, despite the obvious better looks of the 17 Air in all aspects but the color.
posts.text: Gut feel is that üçäiPhone 17 Pro Max is calling my name, despite the obvious better looks of the 17 Air in all aspects but the color.

posts.text_html: Really happy with how things have been improving in the Obsidian space of late. Bases feature looks to be a game-changer (at least for me personally, databases are fun!), and has pulled me back into Obsidian from the comfy confines of the still excellent NotePlan 3 app.
posts.text: Really happy with how things have been improving in the Obsidian space of late. Bases feature looks to be a game-changer (at least for me personally, databases are fun!), and has pulled me back into Obsidian from the comfy confines of the still excellent NotePlan 3 app.
